fundamentalAnalysis.task_1: Check economic calendar for the week

fundamentalAnalysis.task_2: Take notes of any major economic data releases in that week

fundamentalAnalysis.task_3: Check group chats for weekly briefing

fundamentalAnalysis.task_4: Identify risk sentiment in the market

technicalAnalysis.task_1: Check daily time-frame to identify potential trends

technicalAnalysis.task_2: Check 4-HR time-frame to identify potential trends

technicalAnalysis.task_3: Identify key support and resistance levels on Daily & 4-HR time-frames

technicalAnalysis.task_4: Review the previous week's analysis and trades

technicalAnalysis.task_5: Identify potential trade setups for the week

fundamentalAnalysis.task_1: Check economic calendar for the day

fundamentalAnalysis.task_2: Take notes of any major economic data releases in that day

fundamentalAnalysis.task_3: Check group chats for daily briefing

fundamentalAnalysis.task_4: Identify risk sentiment in the market

entryPhase.step_1: Wait for a pullback to the trendline

entryPhase.step_2: Wait for a candlestick pattern to form; engulfing, pinbars, or break-and-retest patterns

entryPhase.step_3: Check for confluence with other technical indicators

entryPhase.step_4: Determine if this a low-confidence or high-confidence setup{e.g., low-confidence setups are when the trend/ S&R levels are weak, and high-confidence setups are when the trend/S&R are strong}

entryPhase.step_5: Depending on the confidence level, determine the position size and risk management{e.g., low-confidence setups should range from 0.25% to 0.50% risk per trade, and high-confidence setups should range from 0.50% to 1% risk per trade. never exceed 1% risk on any trade}

entryPhase.step_6: Enter the trade after all technical indicators are confirmed

entryPhase.step_7: Place stop-loss at a logical level(e.g., below the recent swing high/low or key structure levels)

entryPhase.step_8: Place take-profit at a logical level(e.g., 1:2 risk-reward ratio, or the next resistance/support levels )

managePhase.step_2: Stay up-to-date with all economic data that could potentialy move against you.

managePhase.step_3: if price has moved in your favor; Trail stop-loss to lock in profit.

exitPhase.step_1: Exit if price action invalidates your setup( e.g., a break fails and reenters the range, breaks trend/S&R structure or closes below saftey line.)

exitPhase.step_2: Let trade hit stop-loss or take-profit unless the market structure changes.

exitPhase.step_3: Make sure to journal your trade
